GraphAdapter
Class GraphAdapter

java.lang.Object
  GraphAdapter.GraphAdapter

public class GraphAdapter
extends java.lang.Object

An instance of this class wraps around a JGraph object. This object makes it easier for the user to access relevant information from the JGraph object.

          Holds an instance of the GraphAdapter class.

Field Detail

instance

private static GraphAdapter instance
Holds an instance of the GraphAdapter class. This ensures that everyone uses the same object, and that all the methods are properly synchronized.

Constructor Detail

GraphAdapter

private GraphAdapter()
This constructor does nothing.

Method Detail

appendToGlobalLog

public void appendToGlobalLog(java.lang.String string)
This method allows the user to append a string to the global log.

Parameters:
string - The string to append to the global log.

getCellFromState

private org.jgraph.graph.DefaultGraphCell getCellFromState(State state)
This is a helper method. It searches the JGraph object for the provided state.

Parameters:
state - The state that is in the DefaultGraphCell object that will be returned.
Returns:
The DefaultGraphCell object that contains the provided state.

getCountries

public Countries getCountries()
This method returns the Country object that holds all of the countries that make up the map.

Returns:
The Countries object that holds all of the countries that make up the map.

This method returns the global log.

public static GraphAdapter getInstance()
Returns the singleton GraphAdapter.

Returns:
The singleton GraphAdapter instance.

getNeighbors

public State[] getNeighbors(State state)
This method allows the user to retrieve all of the neighboring states of state.

Parameters:
state - The state the user wants to find the neighbors of.
Returns:
An array of neighbors of state.

getSelectedCells

public java.lang.Object[] getSelectedCells()
This method returns the cells that are selected.

Returns:
Array of cells that are selected.

getTurn

public Country getTurn()
This method returns the country whose turn it is.

Returns:
The Country object whose turn it is.

isPaused

public boolean isPaused()
Returns true if the simulation is paused, and false otherwise.

Returns:
True if the simulation is paused, and false otherwise.

isSimulationFinished

public boolean isSimulationFinished()
Allows the user to tell if the simulation is finished.

Returns:
True if the simulation is finished, and false otherwise.

isVertex

public boolean isVertex(java.lang.Object o)
Returns true if the cell contains a state.

Returns:

setPaused

public void setPaused(boolean paused)
Allows the user to set the paused value.

Parameters:
paused - The value to set the paused variable to. Pass true if the simulation should pause, and false otherwise.

setSimulationFinished

public void setSimulationFinished(boolean finished)
This method allows the user to indicate that the simulation has ended.

Parameters:
finished - False if the simulation has finished. True otherwise.

setTurn

public void setTurn(Country country)
This method is used to set the country whose turn it is. It's important to use this method immediately after the user pauses the simulation.

Parameters:
country - The country whose turn it is.

synchronizeColor

public void synchronizeColor(State state)
Calling this method makes sure that the given state's country's color is the same as the given state's cell's color.

Parameters:
state - The state whose cell's color must be synchronized with its country's color.

togglePaused

public void togglePaused()
Allows the user to toggle the paused value from true to false (or false to true) in one atomic step.
